comment: Took his in person 1321 lecture without any prior coding experience and I was able to catch on really fast. He explains the material really well, and he's pretty chill as long as you aren't staring at your phone or playing minecraft in his class. We played kahoot before tests and the winners got free T shirts and frisbees and stuff. fun class :)

Prof Malcolm is super nice and knows a ton about computers and coding. We played Kahoot before each test and the tests had almost all the same questions. All the bad reviews are people who took the lab for his lecture (all CSE labs are taught by TA's, and all of them use autograders. That's KSU formatting, not anything this prof has control over).

He's extremely by-the-book with no room for deviation period. One of the worst professors I've ever encountered. He doesn't teach you a thing, and when you ask him questions about literally anything, he gaslights and shames you with passive aggressiveness for not looking it up yourself. Avoid taking this course with this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He must not take his job seriously as he doesn't attempt to teach and puts half the assignments into an automatic grader. Also, if you e-mail him with any questions he responds with sass and shames you for not hunting down the answers yourself in either the syllabus or D2L.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Online Savvy

comment: The class and labs were okay. Labs were performed and graded by TAs, and the listed professor was no where to be found in terms of communication. Grading was on the lenient side but sometimes inconsistent. You basically have to teach yourself everything. If you're not a self learner I recommend finding other professors or an in-person option.

The course work is easy 10-12 quizzes the whole year .75% of your grade is based on test. So if you are not a good tester then make sure you study extra hard.He rambles on in his videos making this class even more confusing. You are going to teach yourself. Just go in knowing this won't be an easy semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor was difficult to get in contact with, was NOT clear about due dates or what was to be expected in each assignment, and did not really even put forth effort when I had reached out for help!
This professor is bad. He's definitely not qualified to teach.

Hes a fairly chill guy, it's not his fault the class is setup the way it is. All the tests are really easy to be honest as long as you do the quizzes that are open note, class should be a breeze if you actually do anything.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: honestly, if you can pick a different teacher than him I would suggest you should. his lectures are very boring, and his quizzes are very easy all with open notes, but his tests are very hard and require a lot of studying to pass.

Somewhat chill teacher however, the lectures were very boring and he went off topic a lot. If you can teach your self the material you can get an A in the class. The tests are pretty easy and the quizzes are free 100s.

I think some of the reviews are a little harsh. He has okay lecture videos, despite rambling at times, and the quizzes and assignments themselves are not too terrible. 
However for CSE1300, 60% of your grade is from 3 Exams, this was highly frustrating, because if you had a bad day, you may have just cost a high percent of your grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class was a breeze. The online course materials and lectures do a great job at teaching you what you need. Quizzes are no big deal, and often short. Nothing on the exams comes out of the blue, either. Study the material and you'll do fine. Really chill class.

He had great videos explaining all the topics and 8 easy quizzes to which the answers could be found in the power points and videos. Answered emails within the day. The only thing is missing a quiz will drop your grade A LOT. Tests were fairly easy if you watch the videos. Easy class if you stay on top of it and study the material.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I want to begin by saying that Mr.Malcolm works with what is given to him. He records his lectures and posts them online to review. He abides by the departments strict grading policy as any professor should. Be prepared to teach yourself not because of his fault but because of the departments lack of information in the lectures they constructed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: I wouldn't recommend this professor if you can find someone better. The in-class reviews are nothing like the tests and he never takes late work. I tried to turn in an assignment but the website had some problem that deleted everything I turned in. I showed him proof I turned in and did the assignment before the due date but he really didn't care.

I had to teach myself, and then whenever I studied for a quiz, the material didn't even so up, talked a lot during lectures, but didn't really say anything of value, getting distracted by his own stories for a while, then coming back around to the point 15min later.

Prof will talk about anything but what is actually on the test, even HE doesn't even know what's on the quizzes/tests. Ur better studying the material alone and occasionally listen to his lectures. He is also very strict with late work, will not accept any late work or quiz retakes UNLESS you have a reason that can be backed up with documentation.

Lectures all day over the basics of the content then gives quizzes and test on the finer details. You pretty much have to teach yourself the class. Attendance isn't mandatory and he's a nice person, not so much a professor.

I have Douglas for my lab and I'm not too sure why this happened but for some reason, we have a bunch of TAs teaching the class? I can't understand even understand the professor, who isn't Douglas(even though I signed up for Douglas to be my professor). I haven't been able to get any email responses and my work is being graded seemingly randomly...

I took him for an online course and it was not easy. He doesnt answer emails fast and when he does he just refers you to the syllabus. You will be teaching yourself a majority of the time. If you are new to coding like I was and are taking this class, I recommend to take a in person version because the online version made it much harder.

He comes off as a bit gruff at first, but he's just got a dry sense of humor. Can be a pretty fast talker. All the slides he uses for his lectures can be found online, so if you miss class, it's easy to recover. Homework is very light: a short easy quiz most weeks, and a few tough tests throughout the semester. Not amazing, but gets the job done.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor gave us an assignment that is a make or break for the semester, changed the submission box for the assignment 3 times, the third time 2 days before the due date. I submitted the assignment 7 days before the due date because I'm a full-time worker. Even though I completed the project, I received a 0 because he changed the submission box.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lessons are about a week late from when you need the info. He assigns Labs and Assignments he didn't create or quality check, then the following week after the assignments have been turned in we learn about the material in the assignments.

Above average professor. He's friendly, teaches well, and answers questions clearly. If you've had any coding experience, it's not hard at all. Just practice for the exams and you should pass this class with an A. Most of the people complaining either don't have experience with computers or should be blaming the CCSE department, not the professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Do not take his class !! I got in a car accident and I still could not turn in my work late. He wont accept late work under any circumstances.

This professor knows common mistakes students make and attempts to warn us of them before tests during lectures. I took during covid but I believe normally attendance would be required in his class. I stopped going to lecture about halfway through the semester and my grade fell significantly which means I was learning a good bit from his lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Get ready to read

comment: Prof. Malcolm really does get shafted by the CSE department, and it's only gotten worse since COVID hit. That being said, Prof. Malcolm himself, while he seems like a shy and nerdy guy, is pretty good at explaining CSE concepts. While his lectures mainly rely on PowerPoint, he does his best to make sure everyone understands the course content.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: This teacher was not the grader of the class and rarely graded on time or was really that much of a presence in class. Definitely don't take this class. He is very bad at communication over emails and in person as he normally doesn't answer my questions. Seemed to be confused about HTML.

I enjoy Professor Malcolm's teaching style, as said in many other reviews the problem with the majority of the class is just the program's fault. He is given a set thing to teach and he does his best to help us understand by going in-depth and showing examples.

The responses here are from people who have no idea how computers work. It's clear from day 1 that the department has no idea as to what they're doing for the CS program. He was actually pretty good. Always cared about his students. Quite funny for the average programmer. The class was incredibly easy and the tests are wrong. Expect extra points.

Overall he has been a solid professor. He adds humor to the lectures which helps make the class enjoyable. He may make some blunders here and there but he is quick to correct it and make sure we understand the errors. I really enjoy when he uses repl to demonstrate the material. Helps solidify the understanding. Exams can be tricky so study!

He actually doesnt know what is he talking about you can ask him 2 questions and see as a student you know way more than him, and he doesnt really teach anything if you want to know something he tells you to read the book about it or watch it online on YouTube, worst teacher for Computer

Since most of the homework is done in the Lab, you are just here to get any additional info or help from the lectures which is mostly him reading from the power point and a few details. Not a terrible teacher, a nice guy, and a decent choice, but may not be your first.

The issue with this class is more the faculties fault than it is professor Malcolm. The CS Faculty writes the tests. EVERY exam had obvious typos! The faculty clearly does not proofread the exams before giving them to literally hundreds of students. So while Malcolm is not a bad lecturer, the CS Faculty is terrible!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Good guy, goes through powerpoints and uses repl(it) to demonstrate examples. Throws in a few jokes throughout lecture to lighten the mood and have fun with it. Above average for a Uni prof
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: The stuff people hate about him is not his fault. Whether or not people did well in this class very heavily depended on your experience with programming, as about half the class had very easy A's and the rest were struggling, so it just depends who you talk to. All issues I would blame on the FYE program. He adds very helpful curves to tests.

Honestly a really good professor. He is very reachable and will answer any questions in class, even going over past exams. Honestly, if you understand the concepts and just study the past exams on the CCSE website, you'll do extremely well in this class.

He is a decent prof. He just teaches off the power point and it is adequate. He gives you all the info you need to pass and it always willing to stay after class to answer any questions. The bad reviews are people who ask dumb questions in class and are not in a computing major.

I don't know why they would hire this guy to be a professor. He might be smart but he CANNOT teach. Sometimes, he did not even know what he was talking about and would get sidetracked and just move on to another topic.

He is not a bad choice as a professor. Some of the reviews are not really his fault its more of the departments fault. He listens to his students and answers all of the questions the best way possible. Just be prepared to go over the materials outside of class.

I'm surprised he gets such low ratings, I found him to be a fine professor. I didn't like how the class was in pseudocode, but that isn't his fault at all. He was pretty good at explaining concepts, and I found the lab very useful. He was a new professor, but I honestly had no problems with him at all.

I've really appreciated having Professor Malcolm this semester. It is my first time programming and I found him and his lectures very helpful. He goes over Pseudocode, Java, Python, and C#. He is always patient with us and happy to answer any questions. He is quick to reply to his emails and he always keeps updated on what's going on in class.

He's not a bad choice. He does have a boring voice and all, but most of the problems related to the class are just because of the organization of KSU's CS FYE. He will answer your questions but you HAVE to come prepared. Be prepared to learn some concepts yourself. He tends to base his lectures on the ppt slides but he uses other materials as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Its more the departments fault than his for throwing a brand new instructor into a chaotic program. No one had any clue what was going on. He admitted to not knowing Python, he was likely forced into the position and had no choice but to teach it. Ridiculously monotone lecturer and tries to be funny but it doesn't work. Needs alot more experience.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's new to teaching, and there is a lot of room for improvement. He openly admitted to not knowing the subject material, and asking one of the students if they could teach it. I thought I would learn HTML in this class, and the professor doesn't even know how! I felt scammed. Using Khan academy or w3 schools is a better way to learn this material.

While this may be his first time teaching, the lack of both instruction and clarity show that he is not ready to teach. Combine that with a course that is unorganized and follows no logical progression and you are left with guessing what is expected and how to proceed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class wasn't that great. Despite the poor quality of the new program surrounding this prof, however, he did his best amidst all of the chaos. There are online quizzes over every section, and the textbook is free and online. This semester was his first time teaching, as well, so I imagine he'll improve in the future

The most terrible teacher ever, I get that he is new but he doesn't even seem excited to teach. He doesn't even know what we're doing most of the time, if you ask for help he'll tell us to ask another professor cause he's confused as well. DO NOT TAKE HIM, YOU WILL LEARN NOTHING!!!!!!!!!!! The students in the tutoring center teach better then him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Unclear grading criteria with no rubric as to what to include in assignments. Forced to teach myself 95% of the material for multiple reasons like he doesn't know HTML and made our final project on Python which he talked about for all maybe 45 minutes total this semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class was a disaster. Rubrics were put out to tell us what to do, but even by following the rubric they take points off for random reasons. Midterm was over HTML and he said " I'm sorry guys I don't know much about HTML, but you can use W3 schools to teach you." It's not just his fault, the whole program was terrible.

New professor, teaching a new, disasterous, unorganized FYE course. Very monotone and boring lecturer, tries to be funny. Does in-class pseudocode assignments. Would be better if the course itself was more organized and not constantly changing.

In my opinion, it was a bad idea to have a new professor to teach a brand new class in the first place. Very little classwork and too much lecture. Learning the coding would have been easier if we had in class coding assignments. Also, the textbook is pretty much useless. We don't use it often and the test material has barely anything from it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Stay away from this professor at all costs. He doesn't even know the material he is teaching so you pretty much have to teach yourself anything you will do for this class which includes various programming languages such as HTML and python. Each class day consists of lectures that are not relevant to the content or a guest speaker presenting.

The first teacher I've ever had who openly admitted to not understanding the material. In the same day he proposed our first major project to us, an HTML webpage, he told us he did not understand HTML and asked if anyone in class could stand up front and make a web page. Overall very unprofessional and poor at teaching, needs more experience.
He was a terrible professor. He gave very little direction and didn't seem to even know the topic he was supposed to be teaching. I would not recommend this professor at all.
